website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a model with ample space and a heavy-duty build, this Intex set that includes oars and holders, pump, repair kit, and carrying bag tops our list.
pros: Tops its competitors for features such as the spacious, 5-person size, comfortable seats with backrests, i-beam floor, and thick PVC vinyl material
cons: Large and awkward to handle when inflated
Not for fast-moving water, but great for river or lake cruising

customer_reviews.title: Great day at the lake
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so some of you might be thinking, how does this boat hold up in water. Well this inflatable raft is awesome I have had many hours of enjoyment with this raft and has held strong in lake water. I added an 86lb trolling motor and a total of 2 adults and 2 small children and still have enough room for all our fishing gear and a cooler. This raft is a nice addition to a cheap funfilled day at the lake. It comes with an easy to store bag. My only suggestion is upgrading the air pump and adding wood floors for stability many modification and add-ons can be done to this boat search online for great ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Darkhavoc

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth every penny the boat it self is good strong not too heavy and big enough for 2 even 3 fishermen I have made lots of upgrade to it to make look more pro and comfortable and stable the was afraid that I put too much wight on it but I was surprised with result I absolutely recommend it and 10 big Stars to Amazon check out my Pics
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: This little boat that could
customer_reviews.text: I've waited a long time to review this boat because I wasn't sure how it was going to hold up. Well, now I know, and it's awesome. I take it out on the Chattahoochee river almost every weekend, and it's held up like a champ. I added a few enhancements to her, and she's turned into a pretty sweet boat for being an inflatable. It fits my dog and a fishing buddy no problem. I have both a 30lb and 40lb minn kota motor for it. I initially got the 30, and it works great for ponds and lakes, but I needed the 40lb to get me up stream on the river, which it does flawlessly. Highly recommend this boat.
customer_reviews.author: thatoneguy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still works great after 4 years. It toke me across Delaware bay 17 miles of open water.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Teich

customer_reviews.title: Great little boat
customer_reviews.text: This is a steal! My family loved it. We used it on a smaller lake that wasn't that choppy until kids on jet skis kept riding past us. Much to their dismay it held up and we didn't flip over and we enjoyed the waves 😁 We liked it so much we bought the 2 person inflatable kayak that we plan to use this weekend. Don't debate go ahead and buy it and enjoy the rest of your summer!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying!
customer_reviews.text: We took our maiden voyage along the American River this past weekend (7/25/15) and husband loved the raft (as well as our Rottie). Had a great time, no air leak issues, comfortable. Looking forward to hittin' the lake tomorrow and another Rafting "Expedition" in August! Price was great, pump works better than the electric pump we have!
customer_reviews.author: StokedJourneys

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value here
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value here...large boat for the money!!! Was easy to put together and went nice in the water. I would prefer larger paddles and I hink 5 people in this would be pretty terrifying LOL.....Maybe more like 2 adults and one small child. Adding the optional electric motor would make this one fun boat!!!! Yes I would buy again and I love this for the price! Floating fine with 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: ShellySays

customer_reviews.title: Great raft!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase! Took out on the lake today with my two daughters. Was easy to inflate with our electric pump and easy to deflate. Was very durable and extremely comfortable for the three of us. Plenty of room to move around and really stable in the water. Impressed with the quality and love how the oars break down for storage. Will have lots of great adventures!!
customer_reviews.author: happymom

customer_reviews.title: I got one problem and it's this POS boat!
customer_reviews.text: This boat is JUNK! I have had it less than a month and I went to go clean it and I flipped it over and in the seam on the bottom where it's not actually blown up it's just a thin piece of vinyl it's actually corroded away like almost like a dry rot or something and there's big humongous holes all the way around it and I tried to patch it with a vinyl kit and that didn't work so then I tried this like Flex Seal spray and that didn't work either so it's like this thing is just not worth the money it's chintzy
customer_reviews.author: K_Ranoni

customer_reviews.title: After Ninety Days Company Won't Help
customer_reviews.text: This is what the raft looked like 24 hours after taking it out on it's first trip. Unfortunately for me, my first trip was more than ninety days after the purchase date. I'm left with a useless raft. After ninety days the company won’t accept a return. Know this before you buy this raft.
customer_reviews.author: RickR

customer_reviews.title: Love this boat
customer_reviews.text: I love this boat! My kids and i were in and out of this all summer and it held up great! I would suggest getting a motor but thats more stuff to drag around with you but if it gets windy, its really hard to row when you are sitting on this air boat. I bought a 12v inflator and it takes about 10 to 12 minutes to make this thing full, it also stores nicely as i fit it just fine in the trunk of my Honda Fit. Only mod i really would suggest is to make a wooden bottom for support, otherwise you wont be able to stand up. Get one, its awesome
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Car Guy

customer_reviews.title: Add a wood floor and it's awesome!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a great raft! It's heavier duty than I expected, but not on the same level as the more expensive rafts. That being said, it held up well during a rocky river adventure with small rapids. The WOOD FLOOR MODIFICATION is a must! Cut some 1/2" or 3/4" plywood to fit inside the raft, paint it, and wrap it in some outdoor carpet. Search google and you'll get some ideas. The solid floor makes the raft much more stable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Stevo3000

customer_reviews.title: Raft material is defective, dont waste $$ on it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend and it has an area where the material is weaker and bubbled out when inflated. My bf wont let me return it as he had one prior that did the same thing and doesnt "want the hassel of returning it just to get the same issue on the new one". I did not know about this issue before I bought it. I feel that for what I paid for this raft it should not have any defects. Dont waste your money. I am buying a patching kit but doubt itll help if that bubble blows. Very disappointed with the flaws in this raft.
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my boat!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a boat for a while now but never had the money or a truck and trailer for that matter. After reading tons of reviews I decided to get the Excursion 5 and slapped a trolling motor on it. I got the boat registered for $59 so I can take it out on the Texas lakes and rivers. I've only had a chance to take it out once with a couple friends of mine but the 3 of us had a blast. We all had plenty of room even with the battery riding shotgun with me. If you're looking to get a poor man's boat than this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Austin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the new leisure boater
customer_reviews.text: We are fortunate to live on a river but did not want to invest in a boat until we had seen how much we might use it. The index excursion has been perfect for our family. It has been easy to inflate and doesn't loose air. Even our teenage children can carry and maneuver it. We live on rip rap and it has stood up to going over rocks as well as over the sticks in the river. The seats are comfortable and the oars worked well. We have now invested in an electric motor so that we can go farther. The boat has become a family bonding experience and is especially appreciated during this time.
customer_reviews.author: Lael Hazan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Boat! Very happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Larger and sturdier than expected. Adults and children will enjoy. I am now thinking of purchasing motor! Plan to try fishing from it! Can easily fit 4 adults or two fishermen with gear!
customer_reviews.author: Frankie B.

customer_reviews.title: Seam split after being used 3 times
customer_reviews.text: Product seemed great out of the box. Used it 3 times and the seam started splitting. Will be contacting the company for a refund or warranty or something
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected. But not without faults.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price. Held air intact over a week. Hand pumping air wasn't that bad as long as you aren't in too much of a hurry... However, I ended up not installing the seats at the either end. Because I didn't like that the seat anchors were directly attached to the inflated body without any reinforcement. I didn't want kids pulling on it. Excessive pulls would definitely weaken or rip that area. But without the seats, the seat anchors stick out. Can poke you in the back if not careful... But since you'll be wearing a life vest, it should not bother you.
customer_reviews.author: Digiko

customer_reviews.title: NOT Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write a negative review but this thing is not good. First: It took about 40 minutes to inflate this thing with car air pump. Second: when we on the middle of lake plastic piece on the oar broke and that's was it! only one oar was useful . Good people help us to get to shore. That was it! May be some use for this boat with electric motor on small calm lake or small calm river. Great Thanks to Amazon customer service for refund money for it.
customer_reviews.author: AlexS

customer_reviews.title: Great raft. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the raft. It is stable in the water and has plenty of room. It seems to be well made and held up to the abuse my kids put it through at the lake this last weekend. It is a little on the heavy side though (because it is made with thick, durable materials) and a little awkward to carry down to the lake. I would suggest getting a little help.
customer_reviews.author: J Jones

product_meta.title: Intex Excursion Inflatable Boat Series
feature_bullets: 3 air chambers including an auxiliary air chamber in hull for extra buoyancy
Inflatable I Beam floor for comfort and rigidity. Has 2 welded oar locks on each side
Motor Mount Fitting. Hi Output Manual Hand Pump. 54 inch deluxe aluminum oars. Item is 144.09 long x 66.14 wide in inches
Boston valve on two main hull chambers for quick fill & fast deflate.Do not inflate in 30 minutes after patching
3 air chambers including an auxiliary air chamber in hull for extra buoyancy
Boston valve on two main hull chambers for quick fill & fast deflate
Inflatable I Beam floor for comfort and rigidity
Has 2 welded oar locks on each side
Boston valve on two main hull chambers for quick-fill & fast-deflate. All around grab line
